definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Fig1. Paper is staple food supposing office is restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 如果辦公室是個餐館，紙應該是每天消耗最多的主食。

sentences.english: Their staple food is the fungus cultivated by slaves under the oversight of a taskmaster.
sentences.chinese: 他們的主食是工頭監督下奴隸種植的菌類。

sentences.english: The government has sufficient stockpiles of staples such as wheat and rice.
sentences.chinese: 印度政府的主食儲存，包括小麥和稻米，都很充足。

sentences.english: For example one of my main stable foods are 500g of minced meat.
sentences.chinese: 例如，我的經常性主食是500克切碎的肉。

sentences.english: Seriously, it's time to update this traditional American staple, peeps.
sentences.chinese: 說真的，是時候升級這種美式主食了。

sentences.english: Bring your own healthy entrée or appetizer to the party.
sentences.chinese: 自帶你的健康主食或者開胃菜去聚會。

sentences.english: But it used to be the most popular staple food for people in Northern Shaanxi.
sentences.chinese: 但是這個本土食物在過去是陝北人最家常的主食。

sentences.english: Born in the south from staple food rice, for some strange pasta.
sentences.chinese: 生在南國自幼主食稻米，對面食有些生疏。

sentences.english: In the end, some advices of the research of giant panda' staple food bamboo are supposed.
sentences.chinese: 最後進行了大熊貓主食竹種研究的問題分析及展望。

sentences.english: Eat several small meals throughout the day rather than three big meals.
sentences.chinese: 每天少食多餐而非一天三餐主食。

sentences.english: The Irish were soon almost wholly dependent on the potato as their food staple.
sentences.chinese: 愛爾蘭人很快就幾乎完全依靠馬鈴薯作爲他們的主食。

sentences.english: The main course of roughage will surely causes you longer time than the rice and flour.
sentences.chinese: 粗糧的主食喫起來也肯定比白米白麪慢。

sentences.english: If ever there was a summer-camp staple, it's horseback riding.
sentences.chinese: 如果真有一個夏天營主食，它的騎馬。

definition: grain crops other than rice and wheat
food made from wheat flour, such as noodles, dumplings, buns etc
